text: Rabe (, ) is a village in Serbia. It is situated in the Novi Kneževac municipality, in the North Banat District, Vojvodina province. The village has a Hungarian ethnic majority (91.11%) and its population numbering 135 people (2002 census). A border crossing to Hungary opened in October 2019,ending the village's century isolation,and renewing the traditional ties with the Hungarian village of Kübekháza. ==See also== *List of places in Serbia *List of cities, towns and villages in Vojvodina Category:Populated places in Serbian Banat Category:Populated places in North Banat District Category:Novi Kneževac
title: Rabe (Novi Kneževac)
